tuv.seg: Voting in a referendum
Ag Caitheamh Vóta i Reifreann
If you are listed on the Register of Electors in Ireland, a polling card will be sent to your home before the referendum date
Má tá tú ar Chlár na dToghthóirí, gheobhaidh tú cárta vótála, tríd an bpost go dtí do theach, roimh dáta an reifrinn
Your polling card will include your elector number and will tell you where you can vote
Beidh do uimhir vótála ar do chárta vótála chomh maith le ainm an ionad vótála
It will also include a formal statement explaining what the referendum is about
Beidh ráiteas air, freisin, ag míniú ábhar an reifrinn
You can see a copy of the bill containing the proposal to amend the Constitution on the Oireachtas website
Is féidir leat a fheiceáil cóip den bhille ina bhfuil an togra chun an Bunreacht a leasú ar shuíomh gréasáin an Oireachtais
You may also receive information about the referendum from the Referendum Commission
Cuirfidh an Coimisiún Reifreann. eolas ar fáil, freisin, faoin reifreann
On the day of the referendum, you must go to the polling station stated on your polling card
Ní mór duit dul chuig an ionad vótála atá ar do chárta vótála ar lá an reifrinn
There will be information available at the polling station explaining what the referendum is about
Beidh eolas ar fáil ag an ionad vótála ag míniú an reifrinn duit
You will be given a ballot paper
Gheobhaidh tú páipéar ballóide
Voting is by secret ballot
Is vóta rúnda atá ann
Your ballot paper will contain short instructions on how to vote and will show the title of bill proposing to amend the Constitution
Beidh treoir ar do pháipéar ballóide maidir le conas do vóta a chaitheamh maraon le teideal an Bhille atá ós do chomhair chun an bunreacht a athrú
Your ballot paper will ask you whether you approve of the passing of the bill
Cuirfidh an páipéar ballóide ceist ort an mian leat go ndéanfaí dlí den bhille nua
You must mark "X" in either the "yes" or the "no" box on your ballot paper
Tá ort "X" a chuir sa bhosca do "Tá" nó "Níl" ar do pháipéar ballóide
You may fold your ballot paper to hide how you voted and place it in a sealed ballot box
Is féidir leat do pháipéar ballóide a lúbadh, ionas nach féidir le aon duine do vóta a fheiceáil, agus ansin é a chuir sa bhosca ballóide
You may only vote once at a referendum
Níl cead vóta a chaitheamh ach aon uair amháin i reifreann
Under the Electoral Regulations 2016 (SI 537/2016) a ballot paper template is available to allow voters with visual impairments to mark their ballot papers at a referendum without assistance
Faoi na Rialacháin Toghcháin 2016 (IR 537/2016) tá teimpléad páipéir ballóide ar fáil chun vótálaithe a bhfuil lagú radhairc orthu a gcuid páipéir ballóide i reifreann gan cúnamh a mharcáil
When all the votes are tallied, the referendum returning officer will announce the referendum result
Nuair atá na vótaí go léir istigh agus iad comhairthe tugann an tOifigeach vótála toradh an reifrinn
• You must be an Irish citizen
• Ní mór duit a bheith i do shaoránach de chuid na hÉireann
• You must be at least 18 years old
• Ní mór duit a bheith 18 bliain d'aois ar a laghad
• Your name must be on the Register of Electors
• Ní mór do d'ainm a bheith ar Chlár na dToghthóirí
You will normally be required to vote in person at an official voting centre but you may be eligible for a postal vote if you are:
Is gnách go mbeidh ort vóta a chaitheamh tú féin in ionad oifigiúil vótála ach d’fhéadfá bheith i dteideal vóta a chaitheamh sa phost sna cásanna a leanas:
• An Irish diplomat or his/her spouse posted abroad
• Is taidhleoir Éireannach thú nó is céile thaidhleora Éireannaigh thú atá fostaithe thar lear
• A member of the Garda Síochána
• Is ball den Gharda Síochána thú
• A whole-time member of the Defence Forces
• Is ball lánaimseartha thú de na Fórsaí Cosanta
You may also be eligible for a postal vote if you cannot go to a polling station because:
Anuas air sin, d’fhéadfá bheith i dteideal vóta a chaitheamh sa phost murar féidir leat dul a fhad le hionad vótála mar gheall ar na cúiseanna a leanas:
• Of a physical illness or disability
• Tá galar fisiciúil ort nó tá tú faoi mhíchumas
• You are studying full time at an educational institution in Ireland, which is away from your home address where you are registered
• Tá staidéar á dhéanamh agat ar bhonn lánaimseartha in institiúid oideachais in Éirinn, atá i bhfad ó do sheoladh baile, áit a bhfuil tú cláraithe
• You are unable to vote at your polling station because of your occupation
• Ní féidir leat vóta a chaitheamh ag d’ionad vótála mar gheall ar do phost
• You are unable to vote at your polling station because you are in prison as a result of an order of a court
• Ní féidir leat vóta a chaitheamh ag d’ionad vótála mar gheall go bhfuil tú sa phríosún mar thoradh ar ordú cúirte
Applications for inclusion on the Postal Voters List must be received by 25 November each year at the latest
Ní mór iarratais a fháil go gcuirfear san áireamh thú ar Liosta na Vótálaithe Poist faoin 25 Samhain gach bliain ag an tráth is déanaí
If you are registered as a postal voter, you may vote by post only
Má tá tú cláraithe mar vótálaí poist, ní fhéadfaidh tú vóta a chaitheamh ach amháin sa phost
You may not vote at a polling station
Ní féidir leat vóta a chaitheamh ag ionad vótála
For more information see Registering to vote
Chun teacht ar thuilleadh faisnéise, féach Clárú chun vóta a chaitheamh
You must bring a valid form of personal identification, such as a passport or driving licence, with you when you go to vote
Tabhair leat páipéar aitheantais phearsanta, mar shampla, ceadúnas tiomána nó pas, ag dul chun vótála duit
